name: A Fun Guide to Food Spoilage!

pages.title: Your Steak is a Brick
pages.text: $(bold)Good news:$() You have food!$(br)$(bold)Bad news:$() It's frozen solid.$(br2)Starting in $(bold)Phase 4$(), any food in your inventory accumulates $(italic)frost ticks$() when the temperature drops below $(bold)-30°C$(). The colder it gets, the faster your provisions deteriorate.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Nutritional Advisory: "Food is only food if you can chew it. A frozen steak is a blunt weapon."$()

pages.title: Stage 1: "Chilled"
pages.text: After $(bold)30 seconds$() below -30°C, your food becomes $(b)Chilled$().$(br2)$(li)Tooltip shows frost status$(li)Still perfectly edible$(li)You're in denial. It's fine. Everything is fine.$(br2)This is nature's way of telling you to eat now. You will not listen. You never do.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Tip: If you're saving that steak "for later," later is going to be very disappointing.$()

pages.title: Stage 2: "Frozen"
pages.text: After $(bold)2 minutes$(), your food hits $(1)Frozen$().$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Eating takes 2x longer$() — try chewing a popsicle-steak$(li)$(bold)Restores half hunger$() — ice crystals are not nutrition$(br2)You can still eat it. You'll just hate every second. Like reheated leftover pizza, except somehow worse because it's -60°C and you're crying.$(br2)$(italic)Fun fact: At this temperature, bread has the structural integrity of concrete.$()

pages.title: Stage 3: "Frost-Ruined"
pages.text: After $(bold)5 minutes$(), your food is $(8)Frost-Ruined$().$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Completely inedible$()$(li)$(bold)Permanently damaged$() — thawing only recovers to Frozen$(br2)This isn't food anymore. It's a memory of food. A cold, crystallized monument to your failure to plan ahead.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Wellness Tip: Staring at frost-ruined steak for more than 10 seconds may cause existential dread. This is normal.$()

pages.title: Thawing & Recovery
pages.text: Near heat sources (above $(bold)10°C$()), food will gradually thaw:$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Mild heat$() (10-30°C): Slow recovery$(li)$(bold)Strong heat$() (30°C+): Fast recovery$(br2)Chilled and Frozen food can fully recover to normal if thawed before hitting Frost-Ruined.$(br2)$(bold)IMPORTANT:$() Once food reaches Frost-Ruined, it can only ever thaw back to Frozen. The cell structure is permanently damaged.$(br2)$(italic)Science! It's like frostbite, but for steak.$()

pages.title: The Thermal Container
pages.text: Introducing the $(bold)Thermal Container$() — ORSA's patented food preservation unit!$(br2)$(li)Holds $(bold)8 food items$()$(li)$(bold)Fully insulates$() from frost ticks$(li)Doesn't stack (it's a lunchbox, not a pocket dimension)$(br2)One inventory slot for food security. That's one slot that isn't holding torches, tools, or false hope.$(br2)$(italic)Kevin from Accounting once tried to fit 9 steaks in one. The lid exploded. He still has the scar.$()
Iron for structure, leather for insulation, glass bottle for... science? Look, it works. Don't question ORSA engineering.

pages.title: Frost-Resistant Foods
pages.text: Some foods are naturally immune to frost:$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Golden Apples$() — gold doesn't freeze (it does, but these are magical, shut up)$(li)$(bold)Enchanted Golden Apples$() — literally glowing$(li)$(bold)Dried Kelp$() — already desiccated, nothing left to ruin$(br2)Everything else? $(italic)Fair game.$() Your 64-steak surface sprint strategy just got a lot harder.$(br2)$(bold)ORSA Reminder:$() The thermal container exists for a reason. Use it. Or don't. We're a survival manual, not your mom.
